intro: Haplocarpha lanata, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its scientific name "lanata," meaning "hairy." The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy seed heads similar to those of the true dandelion. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Haplocarpha lanata is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
